channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Meandering? Trump says his 'weave' is oratorical genius
Elon Musk to celebrate Meloni as Italy eyes space sector investment
item.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni will be awarded the Atlantic Council's Global Citizen Award by Elon Musk in New York. Recognized for her role in aiding Ukraine, Meloni has previously discussed Italy’s demographic issues with Musk. They are scheduled to meet again to discuss investment opportunities in Italy’s space and AI sectors.

item.title: France confronts horror of rape and drugging case as 51 men go on trial
Facing 'sleep crisis', Sweden says no screens for toddlers
Kimchi no more? Climate change puts South Korea's beloved cabbage dish at risk
item.description: Climate change is threatening South Korea's production of napa cabbage, essential for kimchi. Rising temperatures and unpredictable rains are affecting the crop's quality and quantity. The kimchi industry faces additional challenges from cheaper Chinese imports. Scientists and farmers are working on solutions, but there are concerns about future cultivation and the iconic dish's availability.

item.title: US military says Yemen's Houthis attacked two crude oil tankers in Red Sea
item.description: The US military reported that Yemen’s Houthi rebels launched missiles and drones, attacking the Saudi-flagged Amjad and Panama-flagged Blue Lagoon I in the Red Sea. These acts, described as 'reckless terrorism,' inflicted minimal damage and no casualties. Both tankers, carrying crude oil, proceeded with their voyages despite the attacks.

item.title: Elon Musk's sarcastic AI image of Kamala Harris as 'Communist dictator' sparks controversy on X: 'Can you believe she wears that outfit?'
item.description: Elon Musk generated controversy by sharing an AI image of Kamala Harris on X, portraying her as a communist dictator. Reacting to her criticism of Donald Trump, Musk's post elicited divided responses. Some users condemned it as misleading and irresponsible, while others backed Musk's concerns regarding Harris's political record.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections 2024: Hand in hand, Biden and Harris hit campaign trail
item.description: US President Joe Biden and Kamala Harris campaigned together for the first time Monday, in a public display of teamwork after she replaced him as candidate and revived Democratic election hopes. I promise you, if you elect Kamala Harris as president, it will be the best decision you will have ever made."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden says Netanyahu is not doing enough to free hostages in Gaza
item.description: President Biden rebuked Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's efforts to secure a cease-fire and hostage release as negotiations face hurdles. Hamas has not finalized which hostages would be released, and Netanyahu faces disputes over military presence in Gaza. Negotiations continue, with input from Qatar and Egypt.

item.title: Bear Fire forces evacuation near Sierra Brooks as blaze rapidly expands
item.description: A rapidly spreading wildfire, known as Bear Fire, has forced mandatory evacuations in the Sierra Brooks area. Initially 30 to 40 acres, it has now expanded to nearly 200 acres, officials report. Firefighters face challenging conditions while the cause remains unknown. Residents are urged to evacuate immediately to ensure their safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Red Sea attacked: Two Oil tankers hit by missiles, no major damage reported
item.description: Two oil tankers, Amjad and Blue Lagoon I, were attacked in the Red Sea near Yemen. The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack on Blue Lagoon I but did not mention the Saudi tanker. The ships continued their voyages with no major damage or casualties. Both shipowners did not immediately comment on the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chicago train shooting: Mass attack on CTA Blue Line leaves four dead, suspect arrested
item.description: Four individuals were shot and killed on a CTA Blue Line train near Forest Park. The suspect, apprehended at a nearby station through video footage, fled the scene. The incident spanned two train cars and has led to concerns about commuter safety. Local officials call for enhanced security on the CTA.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US seizes $13 million Venezuelan leader’s private jet in sanctions crackdown: 'Illegally purchased for President Nicolás Maduro'
item.description: The United States has confiscated a jet used by Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Seized in the Dominican Republic, the $13 million Dassault Falcon 900EX was purchased via a shell company and smuggled out of the US This step signifies the US government’s determination to enforce sanctions against Maduro’s regime.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brooklyn parade shooting: Gunman targets group, injures five during West Indian celebration in NYC
item.description: Five individuals were shot during the West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn, New York City. The suspect targeted a specific group, leaving two critically wounded while the parade continued uninterrupted. Authorities have cordoned off the area and are seeking video evidence to aid the investigation. Thousands of attendees remained, celebrating the 57th annual Caribbean cultural event.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle would return to UK only if...
item.description: ​Prince Harry reached out to the people from his old life and asked help for a strategy for coming back to UK so that he could repair his relationship with King Charles and estranged brother William and then embraced back to the royal fold gradually. One friend reportedly has a strategy planned which will require Harry to carry out low-key royal duties -- like the one he just played attending the funeral of uncle Lord Robert Fellowes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump now has a reply to those who claimed he was 'rude' to Queen Elizabeth
item.description: ​"They said I made the Queen happy, and I said, 'No she made me happy!". This has been written next to a photo of Trump laughing with the late Queen in Trump's new book 'Save America'. A recent book claimed Queen thought Trump was rude and that he had an arrangement with Melania that she would have to remain married to him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Ruined my sex life': 62-year-old man sues Las Vegas hotel after scorpion stung his testicles
item.description: Michael Farchi, 62, has filed a lawsuit against a Las Vegas hotel after being stung by a scorpion on his testicles during the 2023 Christmas holiday. He claims the sting caused PTSD, emotional trauma, and erectile dysfunction. Farchi alleges the hotel was aware of the scorpion infestation due to ongoing construction work.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US seizes Maduro's private jet, says it was illegally purchased
item.description: In a significant move, the US government seized Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's private jet in the Dominican Republic and brought it to Florida. The plane was allegedly purchased illegally through a shell company. This step comes amid disputed election results and widespread protests against Maduro's administration. Aircraft tracking site Flight Radar 24 showed that the jet flew from Santo Domingo to Fort Lauderdale on Monday morning.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Is Kamala on a call?' Trump campaign gives 'zero' to Harris on 'acting skill'
item.description: In the video, as Harris boarded her jet, she waved to the cameras and then went inside. She had a wired earplug attached to her phone. "If you're going to pretend that you're on your phone in order to avoid answering questions from the press, you should probably do a little bit better on an acting job than holding your phone up to your ear while wearing wired headphones," Trump War Room posted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump pats his back for choosing JD Vance: 'Initially, he was...'
item.description: Initially, Donald Trump was troubled as skeletons -- one after another -- started coming out of JD Vance's closet as he was unaware of the most incendiary remarks that were being unearthed, a New York Times Report said. But now Trump credits himself for the choice and compares himself to Hall of Fame football coach Vince Lombardi telling people that his eye for political taken was like Lombardi's ability to find Super Bowl caliber players.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
